snippet: Federal prosecutors have subpoenaed the assistant to the panel’s former executive director to testify, suggesting that the criminal inquiry has moved to a new stage.
abstract: Federal prosecutors investigating New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo's shutdown of Moreland Commission have subpoenaed Heather Green, assistant to anticorruption commission's former executive director, to testify before grand jury; subpoena suggests criminal inquiry has moved to new stage.

byline.original: By WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM and SUSANNE CRAIG

lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors have subpoenaed the assistant to the panel’s former executive director to testify, suggesting that the criminal inquiry has moved to a new stage.

headline.main: U.S. Issues Subpoena in Inquiry on Cuomo’s Closing of Moreland Commission
headline.print_headline: Subpoena for Testimony on Panel Shut by Cuomo

keywords.value: Moreland Commission to Investigate Public Corruption (NYS)
keywords.name: organizations
